## What is CIPWE?

CIPWE is a command-line tool that audits websites for AI-readability. It measures how well AI agents (ChatGPT, Perplexity, Claude, Gemini) can understand, crawl, and answer questions about your content.

Just like:
- **Lighthouse** measures web performance
- **Web Vitals** measure user experience
- **CIPWE** measures AI-readiness

## Key Features

1. **20 AI-Readiness Checks** — JSON-LD, semantic HTML, metadata, crawl signals, content clarity, AI agent directives
2. **Weighted Scoring System** — 100-point scale across 6 categories
3. **Instant Fixes** — Auto-generate llms.txt, JSON-LD, robots.txt, sitemap.xml
4. **Zero Config** — Works with deployed sites or local builds
5. **CI/CD Ready** — JSON output for GitHub Actions integration
6. **Answer Engine Focused** — Optimized for Perplexity, ChatGPT, Claude

## CIPWE Score (100 points)

### Structured Data (30 pts)
- JSON-LD presence (10 pts)
- Valid Schema.org types (8 pts)
- FAQ schema (6 pts)
- Article/Product schema (6 pts)

### Semantic HTML (20 pts)
- Single H1 tag (5 pts)
- Heading hierarchy (5 pts)
- `<main>` element (5 pts)
- `<article>`/`<section>` (5 pts)

### Metadata (15 pts)
- Title tag (5 pts)
- Meta description (5 pts)
- OpenGraph tags (5 pts)

### Crawl Signals (15 pts)
- robots.txt (5 pts)
- sitemap.xml (5 pts)
- Canonical URL (5 pts)

### Content Clarity (10 pts)
- Content density (3 pts)
- Lists & tables (3 pts)
- Q&A structure (4 pts)

### Agent Signals (10 pts)
- llms.txt file (5 pts)
- Structured summary (5 pts)

## Usage

```bash
# Audit any website
npx cipwe audit https://example.com

# Audit local project
npx cipwe audit .

# Auto-generate fixes
npx cipwe fix https://example.com

# Quick score check
npx cipwe score https://example.com

# JSON output for CI/CD
npx cipwe audit https://example.com --json
```

## Why CIPWE?

The web is shifting from link-clicking to answer-getting. Users ask AI agents instead of searching Google. If your site isn't AI-readable, you're invisible to:
- ChatGPT browsing
- Perplexity indexing
- Claude research
- Gemini AI overviews

CIPWE makes your site answerable to AI agents in 60 seconds.

## Target Audience

- Indie hackers building products
- SaaS founders optimizing for discovery
- Technical SEO engineers
- Dev marketers
- Content sites
- AI-first startups
- Agencies serving clients

## Problem Solved

Traditional SEO optimizes for Google's algorithm. But AI agents don't work like search engines — they need:
1. **Structured data** (JSON-LD, Schema.org)
2. **Semantic HTML** (proper headings, `<main>`, `<article>`)
3. **Machine-readable metadata** (OpenGraph, descriptions)
4. **Crawl directives** (robots.txt, sitemap.xml)
5. **Clear content patterns** (Q&A structure, lists, tables)
6. **AI signals** (llms.txt, summaries)

CIPWE audits all of these and generates fixes automatically.

## Technical Details

- **Runtime**: Node.js 18+
- **Package manager**: npm
- **Installation**: Zero-config npx execution or global install
- **Output formats**: Terminal UI, JSON, Markdown reports
- **Architecture**: Modular rule engine with weighted scoring
- **Crawling**: Supports URLs (deployed) and local file paths
- **Generators**: llms.txt, JSON-LD, robots.txt, sitemap.xml

## Commands

- `cipwe audit <target>` — Full audit with visual report
- `cipwe fix <target>` — Generate missing files
- `cipwe score <target>` — Quick score check

Options:
- `--json` — JSON output for CI/CD
- `-o, --output <dir>` — Output directory for generated files

## Real-World Scores

- **example.com**: 18/100 (F) — bare HTML
- **github.com**: 52/100 (D+) — good semantics, no structured data
- **vercel.com**: 56/100 (C-) — has llms.txt, missing JSON-LD

Most sites score 40-60. Getting above 80 requires intentional AI optimization.

## Philosophy

> SEO optimized for Google.  
> CIPWE optimizes for the AI web.

The web is becoming **answer-first**. Users don't click links — they ask AI agents. Your content needs to be:
1. **Findable** — AI agents can discover it
2. **Parseable** — Structured for machine reading
3. **Answerable** — Clear enough to generate accurate answers

CIPWE measures all three.

## What is llms.txt?

`llms.txt` is an emerging standard (like `robots.txt` but for AI). It tells AI agents:
- What your site is about
- What content is available
- How AI should use your content
- Licensing and attribution preferences

CIPWE auto-generates this file with the `fix` command.
